alert.note: Alert for Vega Baja (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 23 at 8:58PM ADT until April 23 at 11:00PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM AST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by previous excessive rainfall. * WHERE...THe Rio Cibuco is running high. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM AST. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. River flooding may close down Route 2 between Vega Baja and Vega Alta. Routes 675 and 676 may also become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 753 PM AST, The River Forecast Center is indicating the presence of excessive runoff from previous rains that could lead to the flooding of Rio Cibuco. Additionally, the USGS River Sensor is indicating the river is in action stage, close to reaching flood stage. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vega Baja, Monserrate and Sabana. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
